mxCell.value:
SmsNotificationResponse response = client.SendSms(
  mobileNumber: "+447900900123", // Required
  templateId: "f33517ff-2a88-4f6e-b855-c550268ce08a", // Required
  personalisation: new Dictionary<String, dynamic>
  {
    { "first_name", "Amala" },
    { "application_date", "2018-01-01" }
  },
  reference: "STRING",
  smsSenderId: "8e222534-7f05-4972-86e3-17c5d9f894e2"
);

  templateId: "f33517ff-2a88-4f6e-b855-c550268ce08a", // Required
  personalisation: new Dictionary<String, dynamic>

    { "first_name", "Amala" },

  },

  emailReplyToId: "8e222534-7f05-4972-86e3-17c5d9f894e2"
);

client.SendEmail(
    emailAddress: "sender@something.com",

mxCell.value:
string templateId = "f33517ff-2a88-4f6e-b855-c550268ce08a";
string reference = "STRING";

Dictionary<String, dynamic> personalisation = new Dictionary<String, dynamic>
{
  { "address_line_1", "Line 1" }, // Required
  { "address_line_2", "Line 2" }, // Required
  { "address_line_3", "Line 3" }, // Required
  { "address_line_4", "Line 4" },
  { "address_line_5", "Line 5" },
  { "address_line_6", "Line 6" },
  { "address_line_7", "AB12 1AB" }, // Last address line must be the post code
  { "first_name", "Amala" },
  { "application_date", "2018-01-01" }
      ... // any other optional address lines, or personalisation fields found in your template
};

LetterNotificationResponse response = client.SendLetter(templateId, personalisation, reference);

A C# class that has a dependency on Notification Factory. 

Add some validation for required fields based off the Notification
Type. See below for mandatory fields for each type.

The class contains 3 separate methods, 1 for each function, a HTTP
Trigger, Queue Trigger, and Timer Trigger. The function body should
should be retrieved and passed into the Notification Factory.

Implementations have a dependency on Gov Notify Notification Client

There is 1 factory class used to determine what concrete
implementation should be created based on the Notification Type in the
body of the request

There are 3 implementations, one for each notification type (SMS,
Email, Letter). These are used to construct the relevant request body
used in the API request to Gov Notify. This object is then past in Gov
Notification Client.

See below for details on how to construct each request.
Nuget package created by Gov to facilitate HTTP requests to the Gov Notify API

UserObject.label:
// Function Request Object
{
  "notificationType": "Email | SMS | Letter",
  "personalisation": {
    "first_name": "Amala",
    "application_date": "2018-01-01"
  },
  "templateId": "f33517ff-2a88-4f6e-b855-c550268ce08a",
  "reference": "string",
  "mobileNumber": "+447900900123",
  "emailAddress": "sender@something.com"
}

  "emailAddress": "sender@something.com", // Required

}

// Letter Notification Request Body
{
  "notificationType": "Letter", // Required
  "templateId": "f33517ff-2a88-4f6e-b855-c550268ce08a", // Required
  "personalisation": {
    "address_line_1": "Line 1", // Required
    "address_line_2": "Line 2", // Required
    "address_line_3": "AB12 1AB" // Required (Validate postcode is last line)
  }
}

mxCell.value: var client = new NotificationClient(apiKey);
nuget install GovukNotify
